    11â†’    container_name: narrative-postgres
    12â†’    restart: unless-stopped
    13â†’    ports:
    14â†’      - "5432:5432"
    15â†’    environment:
    16â†’      POSTGRES_USER: ${POSTGRES_USER:-narative}
    17â†’      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: ${POSTGRES_PASSWORD:-password}
    18â†’      POSTGRES_DB: ${POSTGRES_DB:-narrative_invest}
    19â†’    volumes:

    21â†’    deploy:

    25â†’          cpus: "4"

file.content:
# Narrative Investment - Infrastructure Services (í†µí•©)
# infra-server (10.10.10.10)ì—ì„œ ì‹¤í–‰
# ì‚¬ìš©ë²•: docker compose --env-file .env up -d

services:
  # =============================================
  # PostgreSQL 16 + pgvector
  # =============================================
  postgres:
    image: pgvector/pgvector:pg16
    container_name: narrative-postgres
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "5432:5432"
    environment:
      POSTGRES_USER: ${POSTGRES_USER:-narative}
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: ${POSTGRES_PASSWORD:-password}
      POSTGRES_DB: ${POSTGRES_DB:-narrative_invest}
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
    deploy:
      resources:
        limits:
          memory: 4G
          cpus: "4"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U ${POSTGRES_USER:-narative} -d ${POSTGRES_DB:-narrative_invest}"]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5

  # =============================================
  # Redis 7
  # =============================================
  redis:
    image: redis:7-alpine
    container_name: narrative-redis
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "6379:6379"
    command: redis-server --appendonly yes --maxmemory 512mb --maxmemory-policy allkeys-lru
    volumes:
      - redis_data:/data
    deploy:
      resources:
        limits:
          memory: 1G
          cpus: "1"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "redis-cli", "ping"]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5

  # =============================================
  # MinIO (S3 í˜¸í™˜ ìŠ¤í† ë¦¬ì§€)
  # =============================================
  minio:
    image: minio/minio:latest
    container_name: narrative-minio
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "9000:9000"  # API
      - "9001:9001"  # Console
    environment:
      MINIO_ROOT_USER: ${MINIO_ACCESS_KEY:-minioadmin}
      MINIO_ROOT_PASSWORD: ${MINIO_SECRET_KEY:-minioadmin123}
    volumes:
      - minio_data:/data
    command: server /data --console-address ":9001"
    deploy:
      resources:
        limits:
          memory: 1G
          cpus: "1"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "curl", "-f", "http://localhost:9000/minio/health/live"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 20s
      retries: 3

  # =============================================
  # Streamlit ì¸í”„ë¼ ëŒ€ì‹œë³´ë“œ
  # =============================================
  dashboard:
    build:
      context: ./docker-dashboard
    container_name: adelie-dashboard
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8501:8501"
    volumes:
      - /home/ubuntu/.ssh/id_ed25519:/root/.ssh/id_ed25519:ro
      - /home/ubuntu/.ssh/known_hosts:/root/.ssh/known_hosts:ro
    environment:
      DB_HOST: ${DB_HOST:-10.10.10.10}
      DB_PORT: ${DB_PORT:-5432}
      DB_NAME: ${POSTGRES_DB:-narrative_invest}
      DB_USER: ${POSTGRES_USER:-narative}
      DB_PASSWORD: ${POSTGRES_PASSWORD:-password}
    deploy:
      resources:
        limits:
          memory: 1G
          cpus: "1"

networks:
  default:
    name: narrative-network

volumes:
  postgres_data:
  redis_data:
  minio_data:

1â†’"""í”¼ë“œë°± ê´€ë¦¬ -- ì¼ë°˜ í”¼ë“œë°± / ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°± / ì‚¬ìš©ì í–‰ë™ ë¶„ì„"""

    35â†’
    36â†’# â”€â”€ 3íƒ­ êµ¬ì¡° â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
    37â†’
    38â†’tab_general, tab_briefing, tab_usage = st.tabs(
    39â†’    ["ğŸ’¬ ì¼ë°˜ í”¼ë“œë°±", "ğŸ“° ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°±", "ğŸ“Š ì‚¬ìš©ì í–‰ë™"]
    40â†’)
    41â†’
    42â†’# â”€â”€ íƒ­ 1: ì¼ë°˜ í”¼ë“œë°± â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
    43â†’
    44â†’with tab_general:
    45â†’    render_section_header("ì¼ë°˜ í”¼ë“œë°±", "ğŸ’¬")
    46â†’
    47â†’    # ìš”ì•½ ë©”íŠ¸ë¦­
    48â†’    try:
    49â†’        summary = _query("""
    50â†’            SELECT

    58â†’
    59â†’        if not summary.empty:
    60â†’            row = summary.iloc[0]
    61â†’            c1, c2, c3, c4, c5 = st.columns(5)
    62â†’            with c1:
    63â†’                render_metric_card("ì „ì²´ í”¼ë“œë°±", str(int(row["total"])), icon="ğŸ“‹")
    64â†’            with c2:

    66â†’            with c3:

    68â†’            with c4:

    70â†’                render_metric_card("í‰ê·  í‰ì ", avg_r, icon="rating")
    71â†’            with c5:

    99â†’

   114â†’    elif period == "ìµœê·¼ 7ì¼":

   120â†’

   123â†’
   124â†’    try:
   125â†’        feedbacks = _query(f"""

   144â†’        else:

   197â†’

   267â†’        except Exception as e:
   268â†’            st.error(f"í˜ì´ì§€ í†µê³„ ì‹¤íŒ¨: {e}")
   269â†’
   270â†’    with stat_tab3:
   271â†’        try:
   272â†’            daily = _query("""

   275â†’                    count(*) as count

   281â†’            if not daily.empty:
   282â†’                if HAS_PLOTLY:
   283â†’                    fig = px.line(

   287â†’                        title="ì¼ë³„ í”¼ë“œë°± ì¶”ì´ (30ì¼)",
   288â†’                        labels={"date": "ë‚ ì§œ", "count": "í”¼ë“œë°± ìˆ˜"},
   289â†’                        markers=True,
   290â†’                    )
   291â†’                    fig.update_traces(line_color="#FF6B00")
   292â†’                    fig.update_layout(
   293â†’                        plot_bgcolor="white",
   294â†’                        paper_bgcolor="white",
   295â†’                        font=dict(color="#1A1A2E"),
   296â†’                    )
   297â†’                    st.plotly_chart(fig, use_container_width=True)
   298â†’                else:
   299â†’                    st.line_chart(daily.set_index("date")["count"])
   300â†’            else:
   301â†’                st.info("ìµœê·¼ 30ì¼ê°„ í”¼ë“œë°± ì—†ìŒ")
   302â†’        except Exception as e:
   303â†’            st.error(f"ì¼ë³„ ì¶”ì´ ì‹¤íŒ¨: {e}")
   304â†’
   305â†’
   306â†’# â”€â”€ íƒ­ 2: ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°± â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
   307â†’
   308â†’with tab_briefing:
   309â†’    render_section_header("ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°±", "ğŸ“°")
   310â†’

"""í”¼ë“œë°± ê´€ë¦¬ -- ì¼ë°˜ í”¼ë“œë°± / ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°± / ì‚¬ìš©ì í–‰ë™ ë¶„ì„"""

import streamlit as st
import pandas as pd
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

from utils.database import get_engine, execute_query
from utils.ui_components import (
    inject_custom_css,
    render_section_header,
    render_metric_card,
)

# plotly ì‚¬ìš© ê°€ëŠ¥ ì—¬ë¶€
try:
    import plotly.express as px
    import plotly.graph_objects as go
    HAS_PLOTLY = True
except ImportError:
    HAS_PLOTLY = False

# CSS ì£¼ì…
inject_custom_css()


def _query(sql: str, params: dict | None = None) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """SQL ì‹¤í–‰ í›„ DataFrame ë°˜í™˜."""
    engine = get_engine()
    with engine.connect() as conn:
        return pd.read_sql(sql, conn, params=params or {})


st.title("ğŸ“¬ í”¼ë“œë°± ê´€ë¦¬")
st.caption("ì‚¬ìš©ì ë¬¸ì˜ì‚¬í•­ / ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í‰ê°€ / ì‚¬ìš©ì í–‰ë™ ë¶„ì„")

# â”€â”€ 3íƒ­ êµ¬ì¡° â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

tab_general, tab_briefing, tab_usage = st.tabs(
    ["ğŸ’¬ ì¼ë°˜ í”¼ë“œë°±", "ğŸ“° ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°±", "ğŸ“Š ì‚¬ìš©ì í–‰ë™"]
)

# â”€â”€ íƒ­ 1: ì¼ë°˜ í”¼ë“œë°± â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

with tab_general:
    render_section_header("ì¼ë°˜ í”¼ë“œë°±", "ğŸ’¬")

    # ìš”ì•½ ë©”íŠ¸ë¦­
    try:
        summary = _query("""
            SELECT
                count(*) as total,
                count(*) FILTER (WHERE created_at >= now() - interval '7 days') as week,
                count(*) FILTER (WHERE created_at >= now() - interval '1 day') as today,
                round(avg(rating)::numeric, 1) as avg_rating,
                count(DISTINCT category) as categories
            FROM user_feedback
        """)

        if not summary.empty:
            row = summary.iloc[0]
            c1, c2, c3, c4, c5 = st.columns(5)
            with c1:
                render_metric_card("ì „ì²´ í”¼ë“œë°±", str(int(row["total"])), icon="ğŸ“‹")
            with c2:
                render_metric_card("ì˜¤ëŠ˜", str(int(row["today"])), icon="ğŸ“…")
            with c3:
                render_metric_card("ìµœê·¼ 7ì¼", str(int(row["week"])), icon="ğŸ“†")
            with c4:
                avg_r = str(row['avg_rating']) if row['avg_rating'] else 'N/A'
                render_metric_card("í‰ê·  í‰ì ", avg_r, icon="rating")
            with c5:
                render_metric_card("ì¹´í…Œê³ ë¦¬ ìˆ˜", str(int(row["categories"])), icon="ğŸ“‚")
    except Exception as e:
        st.error(f"ìš”ì•½ ì¡°íšŒ ì‹¤íŒ¨: {e}")

    st.divider()

    # í•„í„°
    col_filter1, col_filter2, col_filter3 = st.columns(3)

    with col_filter1:
        try:
            categories = _query("SELECT DISTINCT category FROM user_feedback WHERE category IS NOT NULL ORDER BY category")
            cat_options = ["ì „ì²´"] + categories["category"].tolist() if not categories.empty else ["ì „ì²´"]
        except Exception:
            cat_options = ["ì „ì²´"]
        selected_cat = st.selectbox("ì¹´í…Œê³ ë¦¬", cat_options, key="fb_cat")

    with col_filter2:
        try:
            pages = _query("SELECT DISTINCT page FROM user_feedback ORDER BY page")
            page_options = ["ì „ì²´"] + pages["page"].tolist() if not pages.empty else ["ì „ì²´"]
        except Exception:
            page_options = ["ì „ì²´"]
        selected_page = st.selectbox("í˜ì´ì§€", page_options, key="fb_page")

    with col_filter3:
        period = st.selectbox("ê¸°ê°„", ["ì „ì²´", "ì˜¤ëŠ˜", "ìµœê·¼ 7ì¼", "ìµœê·¼ 30ì¼"], key="fb_period")

    # ì¿¼ë¦¬ êµ¬ì„±
    conditions = []
    params = {}

    if selected_cat != "ì „ì²´":
        conditions.append("category = %(cat)s")
        params["cat"] = selected_cat

    if selected_page != "ì „ì²´":
        conditions.append("page = %(page)s")
        params["page"] = selected_page

    if period == "ì˜¤ëŠ˜":
        conditions.append("uf.created_at >= now() - interval '1 day'")
    elif period == "ìµœê·¼ 7ì¼":
        conditions.append("uf.created_at >= now() - interval '7 days'")
    elif period == "ìµœê·¼ 30ì¼":
        conditions.append("uf.created_at >= now() - interval '30 days'")

    where = " AND ".join(conditions) if conditions else "1=1"

    # í”¼ë“œë°± ëª©ë¡
    render_section_header("í”¼ë“œë°± ëª©ë¡", "ğŸ“")

    try:
        feedbacks = _query(f"""
            SELECT
                uf.id,
                uf.created_at,
                COALESCE(u.username, 'ë¹„íšŒì›') as username,
                uf.page,
                uf.category,
                uf.rating,
                uf.comment,
                uf.device_info
            FROM user_feedback uf
            LEFT JOIN users u ON uf.user_id = u.id
            WHERE {where}
            ORDER BY uf.created_at DESC
            LIMIT 100
        """, params)

        if feedbacks.empty:
            st.info("í•´ë‹¹ ì¡°ê±´ì— ë§ëŠ” í”¼ë“œë°±ì´ ì—†ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.")
        else:
            # í‰ì ì„ ë³„í‘œë¡œ í‘œì‹œ
            feedbacks["í‰ì "] = feedbacks["rating"].apply(
                lambda r: "* " * int(r) if pd.notna(r) else "-"
            )

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Narrative Investment - Infrastructure Services (í†µí•©)
# infra-server (10.10.10.10)ì—ì„œ ì‹¤í–‰
# ì‚¬ìš©ë²•: docker compose --env-file .env up -d

services:
  # =============================================
  # PostgreSQL 16 + pgvector
  # =============================================
  postgres:
    image: pgvector/pgvector:pg16
    container_name: narrative-postgres
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "5432:5432"
    environment:
      POSTGRES_USER: ${POSTGRES_USER:-narative}
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: ${POSTGRES_PASSWORD:-password}
      POSTGRES_DB: ${POSTGRES_DB:-narrative_invest}
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
    deploy:
      resources:
        limits:
          memory: 4G
          cpus: "4"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U ${POSTGRES_USER:-narative} -d ${POSTGRES_DB:-narrative_invest}"]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5

  # =============================================
  # Redis 7
  # =============================================
  redis:
    image: redis:7-alpine
    container_name: narrative-redis
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "6379:6379"
    command: redis-server --appendonly yes --maxmemory 512mb --maxmemory-policy allkeys-lru
    volumes:
      - redis_data:/data
    deploy:
      resources:
        limits:
          memory: 1G
          cpus: "1"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "redis-cli", "ping"]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5

  # =============================================
  # MinIO (S3 í˜¸í™˜ ìŠ¤í† ë¦¬ì§€)
  # =============================================
  minio:
    image: minio/minio:latest
    container_name: narrative-minio
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "9000:9000"  # API
      - "9001:9001"  # Console
    environment:
      MINIO_ROOT_USER: ${MINIO_ACCESS_KEY:-minioadmin}
      MINIO_ROOT_PASSWORD: ${MINIO_SECRET_KEY:-minioadmin123}
    volumes:
      - minio_data:/data
    command: server /data --console-address ":9001"
    deploy:
      resources:
        limits:
          memory: 1G

    with stat_tab3:

with tab_briefing:

            c1, c2, c3, c4 = st.columns(4)
            with c1:

            with c2:

            with c3:

        render_section_header("ìµœê·¼ ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°±", "ğŸ“")

        bf_list = _query("""

                db.briefing_date::text as briefing_title
            FROM briefing_feedback bf

            display_df = bf_list[["id", "ë‚ ì§œ", "username", "briefing_title", "í‰ê°€", "favorite_section"]].rename(

            )
            st.dataframe(display_df, use_container_width=True, hide_index=True)

            # CSV ë‚´ë³´ë‚´ê¸°
            csv = bf_list.to_csv(index=False).encode("utf-8")
            st.download_button(
                "CSV ë‚´ë³´ë‚´ê¸°",

                key="export_briefing_fb",
            )
        else:
            st.info("ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°±ì´ ì—†ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.")

        st.divider()

        # ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ë³„ í‰ê°€ ë¶„í¬

        bf_stats = _query("""

        if not bf_stats.empty:

                    xaxis_tickangle=-45,

                )

# â”€â”€ íƒ­ 3: ì‚¬ìš©ì í–‰ë™ â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

with tab_usage:

"""í”¼ë“œë°± ê´€ë¦¬ -- ì¼ë°˜ í”¼ë“œë°± / ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°± / ì‚¬ìš©ì í–‰ë™ ë¶„ì„"""

def _query(sql: str, params: dict | None = None) -> pd.DataFrame:

        return pd.read_sql(sql, conn, params=params or {})


st.title("ğŸ“¬ í”¼ë“œë°± ê´€ë¦¬")

# â”€â”€ 3íƒ­ êµ¬ì¡° â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

tab_general, tab_briefing, tab_usage = st.tabs(
    ["ğŸ’¬ ì¼ë°˜ í”¼ë“œë°±", "ğŸ“° ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°±", "ğŸ“Š ì‚¬ìš©ì í–‰ë™"]
)

# â”€â”€ íƒ­ 1: ì¼ë°˜ í”¼ë“œë°± â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

with tab_general:
    render_section_header("ì¼ë°˜ í”¼ë“œë°±", "ğŸ’¬")

    # ìš”ì•½ ë©”íŠ¸ë¦­
    try:
        summary = _query("""
            SELECT

        if not summary.empty:

            with c2:

    st.divider()

        except Exception:

    with col_filter3:

    where = " AND ".join(conditions) if conditions else "1=1"

    # í”¼ë“œë°± ëª©ë¡

    try:

        """, params)

        if feedbacks.empty:

        else:
            # í‰ì ì„ ë³„í‘œë¡œ í‘œì‹œ

                lambda r: "* " * int(r) if pd.notna(r) else "-"
            )
            feedbacks["ë‚ ì§œ"] = pd.to_datetime(feedbacks["created_at"]).dt.strftime("%m/%d %H:%M")

            display_df = feedbacks[["id", "ë‚ ì§œ", "username", "page", "category", "í‰ì ", "comment"]].rename(

                    "í‰ì ": st.column_config.TextColumn(width="small"),
                    "ë‚´ìš©": st.column_config.TextColumn(width="large"),
                },
            )

            st.caption(f"ì´ {len(feedbacks)}ê±´ í‘œì‹œ (ìµœì‹  100ê±´)")

            # CSV ë‚´ë³´ë‚´ê¸° ë²„íŠ¼
            csv = feedbacks.to_csv(index=False).encode("utf-8")

    except Exception as e:

    st.divider()

    # í†µê³„
    render_section_header("í†µê³„", "ğŸ“Š")

    stat_tab1, stat_tab2, stat_tab3 = st.tabs(["ì¹´í…Œê³ ë¦¬ë³„ ë¶„í¬", "í˜ì´ì§€ë³„ ë¶„í¬", "ì¼ë³„ ì¶”ì´"])

    with stat_tab1:
        try:
            cat_stats = _query("""
                SELECT
                    COALESCE(category, 'ë¯¸ë¶„ë¥˜') as category,

                    )

        except Exception as e:

    with stat_tab2:

            if not page_stats.empty:

                    )

        except Exception as e:

    with stat_tab3:

                SELECT

            """)
            if not daily.empty:

# â”€â”€ íƒ­ 2: ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°± â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

with tab_briefing:
    render_section_header("ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°±", "ğŸ“°")

    try:
        # ìš”ì•½ ë©”íŠ¸ë¦­
        bf_summary = _query("""
            SELECT
                count(*) as total,
                count(*) FILTER (WHERE created_at >= now() - interval '7 days') as week,
                count(*) FILTER (WHERE overall_rating = 'good') as good_count,
                count(DISTINCT briefing_id) as briefing_count
            FROM briefing_feedback
        """)

        if not bf_summary.empty:
            row = bf_summary.iloc[0]

            good_pct = f"{int(row['good_count']) / total * 100:.0f}%" if total > 0 else "N/A"
            c1, c2, c3, c4 = st.columns(4)
            with c1:
                render_metric_card("ì „ì²´ í‰ê°€", str(total), icon="ğŸ“Š")
            with c2:
                render_metric_card("ìµœê·¼ 7ì¼", str(int(row["week"])), icon="ğŸ“†")
            with c3:
                render_metric_card("ê¸ì • ë¹„ìœ¨", good_pct, icon="ğŸ‘")
            with c4:
                render_metric_card("í‰ê°€ëœ ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘", str(int(row["briefing_count"])), icon="ğŸ“°")

        st.divider()

        # ìµœê·¼ ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°± ëª©ë¡
        render_section_header("ìµœê·¼ ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°±", "ğŸ“")

        bf_list = _query("""
            SELECT
                bf.id,
                bf.created_at,
                COALESCE(u.username, 'ë¹„íšŒì›') as username,
                bf.briefing_id,
                bf.overall_rating,
                bf.favorite_section,
                db.briefing_date::text as briefing_title
            FROM briefing_feedback bf
            LEFT JOIN users u ON bf.user_id = u.id
            LEFT JOIN daily_briefings db ON bf.briefing_id = db.id
            ORDER BY bf.created_at DESC
            LIMIT 100
        """)

        if not bf_list.empty:
            bf_list["ë‚ ì§œ"] = pd.to_datetime(bf_list["created_at"]).dt.strftime("%m/%d %H:%M")
            rating_emoji = {"good": "ğŸ‘", "neutral": "ğŸ˜", "bad": "ğŸ‘"}
            bf_list["í‰ê°€"] = bf_list["overall_rating"].map(rating_emoji).fillna("-")

            display_df = bf_list[["id", "ë‚ ì§œ", "username", "briefing_title", "í‰ê°€", "favorite_section"]].rename(
                columns={
                    "id": "ID",
                    "username": "ì‚¬ìš©ì",
                    "briefing_title": "ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ ë‚ ì§œ",
                    "favorite_section": "ì„ í˜¸ ì„¹ì…˜",
                }
            )
            st.dataframe(display_df, use_container_width=True, hide_index=True)
            st.caption(f"ì´ {len(bf_list)}ê±´ (ìµœì‹  100ê±´)")

            # CSV ë‚´ë³´ë‚´ê¸°
            csv = bf_list.to_csv(index=False).encode("utf-8")
            st.download_button(
                "CSV ë‚´ë³´ë‚´ê¸°",
                csv,
                "briefing_feedback_export.csv",
                "text/csv",
                key="export_briefing_fb",
            )
        else:
            st.info("ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°±ì´ ì—†ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.")

        st.divider()

        # ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ë³„ í‰ê°€ ë¶„í¬
        render_section_header("ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ë³„ í‰ê°€ ë¶„í¬", "ğŸ“Š")
        bf_stats = _query("""
            SELECT
                db.briefing_date::text as briefing_title,
                count(*) as feedback_count,
                count(*) FILTER (WHERE bf.overall_rating = 'good') as good,
                count(*) FILTER (WHERE bf.overall_rating = 'neutral') as neutral,
                count(*) FILTER (WHERE bf.overall_rating = 'bad') as bad
            FROM briefing_feedback bf
            JOIN daily_briefings db ON bf.briefing_id = db.id
            GROUP BY db.id, db.briefing_date
            ORDER BY db.briefing_date DESC
            LIMIT 20
        """)

        if not bf_stats.empty:
            if HAS_PLOTLY:
                fig = go.Figure()
                fig.add_trace(go.Bar(name="ğŸ‘ Good", x=bf_stats["briefing_title"], y=bf_stats["good"], marker_color="#28A745"))
                fig.add_trace(go.Bar(name="ğŸ˜ Neutral", x=bf_stats["briefing_title"], y=bf_stats["neutral"], marker_color="#FFC107"))
                fig.add_trace(go.Bar(name="ğŸ‘ Bad", x=bf_stats["briefing_title"], y=bf_stats["bad"], marker_color="#DC3545"))
                fig.update_layout(
                    barmode="stack",
                    title="ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ë³„ í‰ê°€ ë¶„í¬",
                    plot_bgcolor="white",
                    paper_bgcolor="white",
                    font=dict(color="#1A1A2E"),
                    xaxis_tickangle=-45,
                    xaxis_title="ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ ë‚ ì§œ",
                    yaxis_title="í‰ê°€ ìˆ˜",
                )
                st.plotly_chart(fig, use_container_width=True)
            else:
                st.dataframe(bf_stats, use_container_width=True, hide_index=True)
        else:
            st.info("ë°ì´í„° ì—†ìŒ")

)

        bf_stats = _query("""
            SELECT
                db.briefing_date::text as briefing_title,
                count(*) as feedback_count,
                count(*) FILTER (WHERE bf.overall_rating = 'good') as good,
                count(*) FILTER (WHERE bf.overall_rating = 'neutral') as neutral,
                count(*) FILTER (WHERE bf.overall_rating = 'bad') as bad
            FROM briefing_feedback bf
            JOIN daily_briefings db ON bf.briefing_id = db.id
            GROUP BY db.id, db.briefing_date
            ORDER BY db.briefing_date DESC
            LIMIT 20
        """)

        if not bf_stats.empty:
            if HAS_PLOTLY:
                fig = go.Figure()
                fig.add_trace(go.Bar(name="ğŸ‘ Good", x=bf_stats["briefing_title"], y=bf_stats["good"], marker_color="#28A745"))

                fig.add_trace(go.Bar(name="ğŸ‘ Bad", x=bf_stats["briefing_title"], y=bf_stats["bad"], marker_color="#DC3545"))
                fig.update_layout(
                    barmode="stack",
                    title="ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ë³„ í‰ê°€ ë¶„í¬",
                    plot_bgcolor="white",
                    paper_bgcolor="white",
                    font=dict(color="#1A1A2E"),
                    xaxis_tickangle=-45,
                    xaxis_title="ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ ë‚ ì§œ",
                    yaxis_title="í‰ê°€ ìˆ˜",
                )
                st.plotly_chart(fig, use_container_width=True)
            else:
                st.dataframe(bf_stats, use_container_width=True, hide_index=True)
        else:
            st.info("ë°ì´í„° ì—†ìŒ")

    except Exception as e:
        st.error(f"ë¸Œë¦¬í•‘ í”¼ë“œë°± ì¡°íšŒ ì‹¤íŒ¨: {e}")
        st.info("briefing_feedback í…Œì´ë¸”ì´ ì¡´ì¬í•˜ì§€ ì•Šì„ ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.")


# â”€â”€ íƒ­ 3: ì‚¬ìš©ì í–‰ë™ â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

with tab_usage:

        # usage_events í…Œì´ë¸” ì¡°íšŒ
        ue_summary = _query("""
            SELECT

        st.divider()

        render_section_header("ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ ìœ í˜•ë³„ ë¶„í¬", "ğŸ·ï¸")
        event_stats = _query("""

        if not event_stats.empty:

                )
                fig.update_layout(

        st.divider()

        # ì¼ë³„ ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ ì¶”ì´
        render_section_header("ì¼ë³„ ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ ì¶”ì´", "ğŸ“ˆ")
        daily_events = _query("""
            SELECT
                date_trunc('day', created_at)::date as date,

def _query(sql: str, params: dict | None = None) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """SQL ì‹¤í–‰ í›„ DataFrame ë°˜í™˜."""
    engine = get_engine()

content.content:
services:
  prometheus:
    image: prom/prometheus:latest
    container_name: adelie-prometheus
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "9090:9090"
    volumes:
      - ./prometheus.yml:/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
      - prometheus_data:/prometheus
    command:
      - --config.file=/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
      - --storage.tsdb.retention.time=30d
      - --web.enable-lifecycle

  grafana:
    image: grafana/grafana:latest
    container_name: adelie-grafana
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    environment:
      GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_USER: ${GRAFANA_ADMIN_USER:-admin}
      GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD: ${GRAFANA_ADMIN_PASSWORD:-changeme}
      GF_SERVER_ROOT_URL: https://monitoring.adelie-invest.com
      GF_AUTH_ANONYMOUS_ENABLED: "false"
    volumes:
      - grafana_data:/var/lib/grafana
      - ./grafana/provisioning:/etc/grafana/provisioning
    depends_on:
      - prometheus

  dashboard:
    build:
      context: ../docker-dashboard
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: adelie-dashboard
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8501:8501"
    volumes:
      - /home/ubuntu/.ssh/id_ed25519:/root/.ssh/id_ed25519:ro
      - /home/ubuntu/.ssh/known_hosts:/root/.ssh/known_hosts:ro
    environment:
      DB_HOST: ${DB_HOST:-10.10.10.20}
      DB_PORT: ${DB_PORT:-5432}
      DB_NAME: ${DB_NAME:-narrative_invest}
      DB_USER: ${DB_USER:-narative}
      DB_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-password}
      PROMETHEUS_URL: http://adelie-prometheus:9090
      GRAFANA_URL: https://monitoring.adelie-invest.com
    depends_on:
      - prometheus

  cadvisor:
    image: gcr.io/cadvisor/cadvisor:latest
    container_name: adelie-cadvisor
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8080:8080"
    volumes:
      - /:/rootfs:ro
      - /var/run:/var/run:ro
      - /sys:/sys:ro
      - /var/lib/docker/:/var/lib/docker:ro
      - /dev/disk/:/dev/disk:ro
    privileged: true
    devices:
      - /dev/kmsg

  # node-exporter: deploy-test ì„œë²„ì— systemd ì„œë¹„ìŠ¤ë¡œ ì´ë¯¸ ì„¤ì¹˜/ìš´í–‰ ì¤‘ (í¬íŠ¸ 9100)
  # ë³„ë„ ì»¨í…Œì´ë„ˆ ë¶ˆí•„ìš” â€” prometheus.ymlì´ 10.10.10.20:9100 ì§ì ‘ ìŠ¤í¬ë ˆì´í•‘

volumes:
  prometheus_data:
  grafana_data:

The `infra/docker-compose.yml` has postgres, redis, minio, and dashboard - but that file seems to be for the infra server (10.10.10.10), while the monitoring one is for deploy-test (10.10.10.20).

So I need to:
1. Also modify `infra/monitoring/docker-compose.yml` to add the `adelie-network` external network and update `DB_HOST`

services:
  prometheus:
    image: prom/prometheus:latest
    container_name: adelie-prometheus
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "9090:9090"
    volumes:
      - ./prometheus.yml:/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
      - prometheus_data:/prometheus
    command:
      - --config.file=/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
      - --storage.tsdb.retention.time=30d
      - --web.enable-lifecycle

  grafana:
    image: grafana/grafana:latest
    container_name: adelie-grafana
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    environment:
      GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_USER: ${GRAFANA_ADMIN_USER:-admin}
      GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD: ${GRAFANA_ADMIN_PASSWORD:-changeme}
      GF_SERVER_ROOT_URL: https://monitoring.adelie-invest.com
      GF_AUTH_ANONYMOUS_ENABLED: "false"
    volumes:
      - grafana_data:/var/lib/grafana
      - ./grafana/provisioning:/etc/grafana/provisioning
    depends_on:
      - prometheus

  dashboard:
    build:
      context: ../docker-dashboard
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: adelie-dashboard
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8501:8501"
    volumes:
      - /home/ubuntu/.ssh/id_ed25519:/root/.ssh/id_ed25519:ro
      - /home/ubuntu/.ssh/known_hosts:/root/.ssh/known_hosts:ro
    environment:
      DB_HOST: ${DB_HOST:-10.10.10.20}
      DB_PORT: ${DB_PORT:-5432}
      DB_NAME: ${DB_NAME:-narrative_invest}
      DB_USER: ${DB_USER:-narative}
      DB_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-password}
      PROMETHEUS_URL: http://adelie-prometheus:9090
      GRAFANA_URL: https://monitoring.adelie-invest.com
    depends_on:
      - prometheus

  cadvisor:
    image: gcr.io/cadvisor/cadvisor:latest
    container_name: adelie-cadvisor
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8080:8080"
    volumes:
      - /:/rootfs:ro
      - /var/run:/var/run:ro
      - /sys:/sys:ro
      - /var/lib/docker/:/var/lib/docker:ro
      - /dev/disk/:/dev/disk:ro
    privileged: true
    devices:
      - /dev/kmsg

  # node-exporter: deploy-test ì„œë²„ì— systemd ì„œë¹„ìŠ¤ë¡œ ì´ë¯¸ ì„¤ì¹˜/ìš´í–‰ ì¤‘ (í¬íŠ¸ 9100)
  # ë³„ë„ ì»¨í…Œì´ë„ˆ ë¶ˆí•„ìš” â€” prometheus.ymlì´ 10.10.10.20:9100 ì§ì ‘ ìŠ¤í¬ë ˆì´í•‘

volumes:
  prometheus_data:
  grafana_data:

"""SQLAlchemy DB ì¡°íšŒ ìœ í‹¸ë¦¬í‹° â€” SELECT ì „ìš©"""

import re

import pandas as pd
import streamlit as st
from sqlalchemy import create_engine, text

from config import DB_CONFIG

# ìœ„í—˜í•œ SQL í‚¤ì›Œë“œ ì°¨ë‹¨
_DANGEROUS_PATTERN = re.compile(
    r"\b(INSERT|UPDATE|DELETE|DROP|ALTER|TRUNCATE|CREATE|GRANT|REVOKE)\b",
    re.IGNORECASE,
)

_engine = None


def get_engine():
    """SQLAlchemy ì—”ì§„ (ì‹±ê¸€í„´)"""
    global _engine
    if _engine is None:
        url = (
            f"postgresql://{DB_CONFIG['user']}:{DB_CONFIG['password']}"
            f"@{DB_CONFIG['host']}:{DB_CONFIG['port']}/{DB_CONFIG['dbname']}"
        )
        _engine = create_engine(url, pool_pre_ping=True)
    return _engine


def execute_query(sql: str, params: dict | None = None) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """SELECT ì¿¼ë¦¬ ì‹¤í–‰ â†’ DataFrame ë°˜í™˜. ë¹„-SELECT ì¿¼ë¦¬ëŠ” ì°¨ë‹¨."""
    if _DANGEROUS_PATTERN.search(sql):
        raise ValueError("SELECT ì¿¼ë¦¬ë§Œ í—ˆìš©ë©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ìˆ˜ì •/ì‚­ì œ ì¿¼ë¦¬ëŠ” ì‹¤í–‰í•  ìˆ˜ ì—†ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.")

    with get_engine().connect() as conn:
        return pd.read_sql_query(text(sql), conn, params=params)


@st.cache_data(ttl=300)
def get_tables() -> pd.DataFrame:
    """ì „ì²´ í…Œì´ë¸” ëª©ë¡ + í–‰ ìˆ˜ (5ë¶„ ìºì‹œ)"""
    sql = """
    SELECT
        t.table_name,
        COALESCE(s.n_live_tup, 0) AS row_count
    FROM information_schema.tables t
    LEFT JOIN pg_stat_user_tables s ON t.table_name = s.relname
    WHERE t.table_schema = 'public'
      AND t.table_type = 'BASE TABLE'
    ORDER BY t.table_name
    """
    return execute_query(sql)


def get_table_schema(table_name: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """í…Œì´ë¸” ì»¬ëŸ¼ ì •ë³´"""
    sql = """
    SELECT
        column_name,
        data_type,
        is_nullable,
        column_default,
        character_maximum_length
    FROM information_schema.columns
    WHERE table_schema = 'public' AND table_name = :table_name
    ORDER BY ordinal_position
    """
    return execute_query(sql, {"table_name": table_name})


def get_table_preview(table_name: str, limit: int = 50) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """í…Œì´ë¸” ìµœê·¼ Ní–‰ ë¯¸ë¦¬ë³´ê¸°"""
    # í…Œì´ë¸”ëª… ê²€ì¦ (SQL injection ë°©ì§€)
    if not re.match(r"^[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*$", table_name):
        raise ValueError(f"ìœ íš¨í•˜ì§€ ì•Šì€ í…Œì´ë¸”ëª…: {table_name}")
    limit = min(limit, 500)  # ìµœëŒ€ 500í–‰
    sql = f'SELECT * FROM "{table_name}" ORDER BY 1 DESC LIMIT {limit}'
    return execute_query(sql)

    20â†’def get_engine():

    27â†’        )
    28â†’        _engine = create_engine(url, pool_pre_ping=True)

    30â†’
    31â†’
    32â†’def execute_query(sql: str, params: dict | None = None) -> pd.DataFrame:
    33â†’    """SELECT ì¿¼ë¦¬ ì‹¤í–‰ â†’ DataFrame ë°˜í™˜. ë¹„-SELECT ì¿¼ë¦¬ëŠ” ì°¨ë‹¨."""
    34â†’    if _DANGEROUS_PATTERN.search(sql):

    36â†’
    37â†’    with get_engine().connect() as conn:
    38â†’        return pd.read_sql_query(text(sql), conn, params=params)

    42â†’def get_tables() -> pd.DataFrame:
    43â†’    """ì „ì²´ í…Œì´ë¸” ëª©ë¡ + í–‰ ìˆ˜ (5ë¶„ ìºì‹œ)"""
    44â†’    sql = """
    45â†’    SELECT
    46â†’        t.table_name,
    47â†’        COALESCE(s.n_live_tup, 0) AS row_count
    48â†’    FROM information_schema.tables t
    49â†’    LEFT JOIN pg_stat_user_tables s ON t.table_name = s.relname
    50â†’    WHERE t.table_schema = 'public'
    51â†’      AND t.table_type = 'BASE TABLE'

    54â†’    return execute_query(sql)

    57â†’def get_table_schema(table_name: str) -> pd.DataFrame:

    59â†’    sql = """

    70â†’    return execute_query(sql, {"table_name": table_name})

    73â†’def get_table_preview(table_name: str, limit: int = 50) -> pd.DataFrame:

```python
        )
        _engine = create_engine(url, pool_pre_ping=True)
    return _engine


def execute_query(sql: str, params: dict | None = None) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """SELECT ì¿¼ë¦¬ ì‹¤í–‰ â†’ DataFrame ë°˜í™˜. ë¹„-SELECT ì¿¼ë¦¬ëŠ” ì°¨ë‹¨."""
    if _DANGEROUS_PATTERN.search(sql):
        raise ValueError("SELECT ì¿¼ë¦¬ë§Œ í—ˆìš©ë©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ìˆ˜ì •/ì‚­ì œ ì¿¼ë¦¬ëŠ” ì‹¤í–‰í•  ìˆ˜ ì—†ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.")

    with get_engine().connect() as conn:
        return pd.read_sql_query(text(sql), conn, params=params)


@st.cache_data(ttl=300)
def get_tables() -> pd.DataFrame:
    """ì „ì²´ í…Œì´ë¸” ëª©ë¡ + í–‰ ìˆ˜ (5ë¶„ ìºì‹œ)"""
    sql = """
    SELECT
        t.table_name,
        COALESCE(s.n_live_tup, 0) AS row_count
    FROM information_schema.tables t
    LEFT JOIN pg_stat_user_tables s ON t.table_name = s.relname
    WHERE t.table_schema = 'public'
      AND t.table_type = 'BASE TABLE'
    ORDER BY t.table_name
    """
    return execute_query(sql)


def get_table_schema(table_name: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """í…Œì´ë¸” ì»¬ëŸ¼ ì •ë³´"""
    sql = """
    SELECT
        column_name,
        data_type,
        is_nullable,
        column_default,
        character_maximum_length
    FROM information_schema.columns
    WHERE table_schema = 'public' AND table_name = :table_name
    ORDER BY ordinal_position
    """
    return execute_query(sql, {"table_name": table_name})


def get_table_preview(table_name: str, limit: int = 50) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """í…Œì´ë¸” ìµœê·¼ Ní–‰ ë¯¸ë¦¬ë³´ê¸°"""
    # í…Œì´ë¸”ëª… ê²€ì¦ (SQL injection ë°©ì§€)
    if not re.match(r"^[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*$", table_name):
        raise ValueError(f"ìœ íš¨í•˜ì§€ ì•Šì€ í…Œì´ë¸”ëª…: {table_name}")
    limit = min(limit, 500)  # ìµœëŒ€ 500í–‰
    sql = f'SELECT * FROM "{table_name}" ORDER BY 1 DESC LIMIT {limit}'
    return execute_query(sql)
```

### ì£¼ìš” êµ¬í˜„ ë¶„ì„:
- **`get_engine()`**: SQLAlchemy ì—”ì§„ì„ ì‹±ê¸€í„´ íŒ¨í„´ìœ¼ë¡œ ê´€ë¦¬ (DB ì—°ê²° ì¬ì‚¬ìš©)
  - PostgreSQL ë°ì´í„°ë² ì´ìŠ¤ì— ì—°ê²°
  - `pool_pre_ping=True`ë¡œ ì—°ê²° ì •ìƒ ì—¬ë¶€ í™•ì¸
  
- **`execute_query(sql, params)`**: SELECT ì¿¼ë¦¬ë§Œ ì‹¤í–‰
  - **ë³´ì•ˆ**: `_DANGEROUS_PATTERN` regexë¡œ INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE/DROP ë“± ìœ„í—˜í•œ ì¿¼ë¦¬ ì°¨ë‹¨
  - `params` dictë¡œ íŒŒë¼ë¯¸í„°í™”ëœ ì¿¼ë¦¬ ì§€ì› (SQL injection ë°©ì§€)
  - ë°˜í™˜: pandas DataFrame

- **`get_tables()`**: ê³µê°œ ìŠ¤í‚¤ë§ˆì˜ ëª¨ë“  í…Œì´ë¸” + í–‰ ìˆ˜
  - 5ë¶„ TTLë¡œ ìºì‹œ (`@st.cache_data`)

- **`get_table_schema(table_name)`**: íŠ¹ì • í…Œì´ë¸”ì˜ ì»¬ëŸ¼ ì •ë³´
  - íŒŒë¼ë¯¸í„°í™”ëœ ì¿¼ë¦¬ë¡œ SQL injection ë°©ì§€

- **`get_table_preview(table_name, limit)`**: í…Œì´ë¸” ë¯¸ë¦¬ë³´ê¸°
  - í…Œì´ë¸”ëª… regex ê²€ì¦ (alphanumeric + underscoreë§Œ í—ˆìš©)
  - ìµœëŒ€ 500í–‰ ì œí•œ

```python
def _query(sql: str, params: dict | None = None) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """SQL ì‹¤í–‰ í›„ DataFrame ë°˜í™˜."""
    engine = get_engine()
    with engine.connect() as conn:
        return pd.read_sql_query(text(sql), conn, params=params or {})
```

```python
"""SQLAlchemy DB ì¡°íšŒ ìœ í‹¸ë¦¬í‹° â€” SELECT ì „ìš©"""

import re

import pandas as pd
import streamlit as st
from sqlalchemy import create_engine, text

from config import DB_CONFIG

# ìœ„í—˜í•œ SQL í‚¤ì›Œë“œ ì°¨ë‹¨
_DANGEROUS_PATTERN = re.compile(
    r"\b(INSERT|UPDATE|DELETE|DROP|ALTER|TRUNCATE|CREATE|GRANT|REVOKE)\b",
    re.IGNORECASE,
)

_engine = None


def get_engine():
    """SQLAlchemy ì—”ì§„ (ì‹±ê¸€í„´)"""
    global _engine
    if _engine is None:
        url = (
            f"postgresql://{DB_CONFIG['user']}:{DB_CONFIG['password']}"
            f"@{DB_CONFIG['host']}:{DB_CONFIG['port']}/{DB_CONFIG['dbname']}"
        )
        _engine = create_engine(url, pool_pre_ping=True)
    return _engine


def execute_query(sql: str, params: dict | None = None) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """SELECT ì¿¼ë¦¬ ì‹¤í–‰ â†’ DataFrame ë°˜í™˜. ë¹„-SELECT ì¿¼ë¦¬ëŠ” ì°¨ë‹¨."""
    if _DANGEROUS_PATTERN.search(sql):
        raise ValueError("SELECT ì¿¼ë¦¬ë§Œ í—ˆìš©ë©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ìˆ˜ì •/ì‚­ì œ ì¿¼ë¦¬ëŠ” ì‹¤í–‰í•  ìˆ˜ ì—†ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.")

    with get_engine().connect() as conn:
        return pd.read_sql_query(text(sql), conn, params=params)


@st.cache_data(ttl=300)
def get_tables() -> pd.DataFrame:
    """ì „ì²´ í…Œì´ë¸” ëª©ë¡ + í–‰ ìˆ˜ (5ë¶„ ìºì‹œ)"""
    sql = """
    SELECT
        t.table_name,
        COALESCE(s.n_live_tup, 0) AS row_count
    FROM information_schema.tables t
    LEFT JOIN pg_stat_user_tables s ON t.table_name = s.relname
    WHERE t.table_schema = 'public'
      AND t.table_type = 'BASE TABLE'
    ORDER BY t.table_name
    """
    return execute_query(sql)


def get_table_schema(table_name: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """í…Œì´ë¸” ì»¬ëŸ¼ ì •ë³´"""
    sql = """
    SELECT
        column_name,
        data_type,
        is_nullable,
        column_default,
        character_maximum_length
    FROM information_schema.columns
    WHERE table_schema = 'public' AND table_name = :table_name
    ORDER BY ordinal_position
    """
    return execute_query(sql, {"table_name": table_name})


def get_table_preview(table_name: str, limit: int = 50) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """í…Œì´ë¸” ìµœê·¼ Ní–‰ ë¯¸ë¦¬ë³´ê¸°"""
    # í…Œì´ë¸”ëª… ê²€ì¦ (SQL injection ë°©ì§€)
    if not re.match(r"^[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*$", table_name):
        raise ValueError(f"ìœ íš¨í•˜ì§€ ì•Šì€ í…Œì´ë¸”ëª…: {table_name}")
    limit = min(limit, 500)  # ìµœëŒ€ 500í–‰
    sql = f'SELECT * FROM "{table_name}" ORDER BY 1 DESC LIMIT {limit}'
    return execute_query(sql)
```

### DB ì¿¼ë¦¬ ë°©ì‹ ë¶„ì„:
- **ì§ì ‘ SQL ì¿¼ë¦¬ ì‚¬ìš©**: `execute_query()`ì— SQL ë¬¸ìì—´ ì „ë‹¬
- **íŒŒë¼ë¯¸í„°í™” ì—†ìŒ**: ëŒ€ë¶€ë¶„ì˜ ì¿¼ë¦¬ê°€ í•˜ë“œì½”ë”©ëœ SQL
- **JSONB ì²˜ë¦¬**: `jsonb_array_length()`, `jsonb_array_elements()`, `->>' ì—°ì‚°ì ì‚¬ìš©
- **PostgreSQL í•¨ìˆ˜**: `CURRENT_DATE`, `date_trunc()`, `now()` ë“±
- **4ê°œ íƒ­ êµ¬ì¡°**:
  1. í…Œì´ë¸” ë¸Œë¼ìš°ì € (ìŠ¤í‚¤ë§ˆ + ë¯¸ë¦¬ë³´ê¸° + ì»¤ìŠ¤í…€ SQL)
  2. íŒŒì´í”„ë¼ì¸ ìƒíƒœ (ìµœê·¼ ì‹¤í–‰ ê¸°ë¡ + í‚¤ì›Œë“œ í˜„í™©)
  3. ë¹„ì¦ˆë‹ˆìŠ¤ ëŒ€ì‹œë³´ë“œ (KPI + í‚¤ì›Œë“œ ë¶„í¬)
  4. ë°ì´í„° ê´€ë¦¬ (ì´ˆê¸°í™” + íŒŒì´í”„ë¼ì¸ ì¬ì‹¤í–‰ - SSH ëª…ë ¹)

    18â†’class SSHManager:

Now I have a clearer picture. The issue is:

1. `ui_components.py` imports from:
   - `config` (HEALTH_CHECK_ENDPOINT, REDIS_CONTAINER_FILTER, POSTGRES_CONTAINER_FILTER)
   - `utils.ssh` (run_cmd, is_server_online)
   - `utils.docker_cmd` (container_action, container_logs, compose_up, compose_down, compose_pull, docker_stats)

2. `utils/ssh.py` imports `paramiko` and creates a `SSHManager` singleton at **module level** (line 106: `ssh_manager = SSHManager()`)


3. The `SSHManager.__new__()` method initializes with an empty connections dict without attempting any SSH connection, so that's not the problem.
4. When `utils/docker_cmd.py` imports `run_cmd` from `utils.ssh`, it triggers the ssh.py module to load and instantiate the singleton, which should work fine since `paramiko>=3.5` is listed in requirements.txt.
5. I'm realizing there might be something else going on with the import chain that I'm missing.

Actually, the `SSHManager` instance created at module level in ssh.py doesn't trigger any connection attempts during initialization. But I'm wondering if the issue is with how Streamlit decorators like `@st.cache_data` behave when applied to functions at import time in `docker_cmd.py` â€” depending on the Streamlit version, this could potentially cause problems during the import phase.

Let me reconsider whether the container might actually be running an older version of `ui_components.py`. The explore agent confirmed the local version has 487 lines with all the expected functions, but what if the Docker image was built from an earlier commit that didn't include those functions? That would explain why the container can't find `inject_custom_css` even though the current local file has it. docker-dashboard/Dockerfile` which copies the whole directory

So when we ran `docker compose build dashboard` and `docker compose up -d --force-recreate dashboard`, a new image was built with the current code. The current `ui_components.py` has `inject_custom_css`.

But wait â€” when was the Docker image rebuilt? Let me think about the sequence:

Previous session:
1. Modified `feedback.py` locally
2. Committed to develop
3. On deploy-test: `git checkout origin/develop -- infra/docker-dashboard/pages/feedback.py` â†’ got latest feedback.py
4. `docker compose build dashboard` â†’ rebuilt with latest `feedback.py` AND the current `ui_components.py` from deploy-test's file system
5. `docker compose up -d --force-recreate dashboard` â†’ container recreated

The key question is: what version of `ui_components.py` is actually on the deploy-test machine? Since deploy-test is on the `prod` branch, it might be running an older version of that file. I should check the git history for `ui_components.py` and also directly inspect what's in the running container to see the actual content.

content.thinking:
Good. The plan has been updated to reflect new errors. Let me now explore the current state of the files to validate the plan and check if there are any issues with the approach.

Key things to investigate:
1. Current `infra/monitoring/docker-compose.yml` state
2. Current `.streamlit/config.toml` state
3. How the Cloudflare Tunnel is configured (to understand the flow)
4. Whether the nginx approach is correct for fixing the `_stcore` 404 issue

Let me also think about the `_stcore` issue more carefully:

The problem: When Streamlit navigates to `/feedback`, the JS tries to fetch `_stcore` relative to the current URL (`/feedback/_stcore/health`). 

The nginx rewrite approach in the plan handles this by redirecting `/[pagename]/_stcore/...` back to `/_stcore/...`, which is cleaner than trying to configure Streamlit's `basePath` or `baseUrlPath` parameters. But I need to reconsider whether this is the right fix given that the domain is being served through a Cloudflare Tunnel. The requirements specify `streamlit>=1.41`, so the actual installed version might differ from what I initially thought. The real problem is that when Streamlit's navigation changes the URL to something like `/feedback`, the WebSocket and resource requests follow that path, looking for `/_stcore/` endpoints under `/feedback/` instead of at the root. This is fundamentally a base path configuration issue, and while Streamlit's `baseUrlPath` setting defaults to empty (root), the nginx reverse proxy approach in the plan handles this correctly by rewriting paths before they reach Streamlit.

Verifying the nginx regex pattern...

So the capture group `$1` correctly extracts `_stcore/host-config` and passes it to the dashboard service. For the docker-compose setup, I'm routing external traffic on port 8501 through nginx to the internal dashboard service, with nginx handling the path rewriting. Now I need to check what other URL patterns might be affected by this routing change, particularly those with different prefixes like `/dev-yj99son/_stcore/...`.

The regex pattern should catch all of these variations since it matches any path prefix followed by `_stcore`. But I'm realizing there might be other Streamlit resources beyond just `_stcore` that need routingâ€”static files, WebSocket streams, and page-specific resources. The core issue is really just handling the `_stcore` path when navigating to sub-pages, which the nginx config should address. One thing I need to verify is whether the `dashboard` hostname will properly resolve within the Docker network when nginx tries to proxy requests to it. The regex pattern correctly strips the `/feedback` prefix and routes the Streamlit internal requests to the right endpoint. Now I need to verify the config.toml setup and check whether the ImportError was actually resolved with a cache-busting rebuild.

1â†’services:
     2â†’  prometheus:
     3â†’    image: prom/prometheus:latest
     4â†’    container_name: adelie-prometheus
     5â†’    restart: unless-stopped
     6â†’    ports:
     7â†’      - "9090:9090"
     8â†’    volumes:
     9â†’      - ./prometheus.yml:/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
    10â†’      - prometheus_data:/prometheus
    11â†’    command:
    12â†’      - --config.file=/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
    13â†’      - --storage.tsdb.retention.time=30d
    14â†’      - --web.enable-lifecycle
    15â†’
    16â†’  grafana:
    17â†’    image: grafana/grafana:latest
    18â†’    container_name: adelie-grafana
    19â†’    restart: unless-stopped
    20â†’    ports:
    21â†’      - "3000:3000"
    22â†’    environment:
    23â†’      GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_USER: ${GRAFANA_ADMIN_USER:-admin}
    24â†’      GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD: ${GRAFANA_ADMIN_PASSWORD:-changeme}
    25â†’      GF_SERVER_ROOT_URL: https://monitoring.adelie-invest.com
    26â†’      GF_AUTH_ANONYMOUS_ENABLED: "false"
    27â†’    volumes:
    28â†’      - grafana_data:/var/lib/grafana
    29â†’      - ./grafana/provisioning:/etc/grafana/provisioning
    30â†’    depends_on:

    32â†’
    33â†’  dashboard:

    44â†’    environment:

    52â†’    networks:

    54â†’      - adelie-network
    55â†’    depends_on:
    56â†’      - prometheus
    57â†’
    58â†’  cadvisor:

1â†’groups:
     2â†’  - name: infrastructure
     3â†’    rules:
     4â†’      - alert: HighCPU
     5â†’        expr: 100 - (avg by(instance)(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle"}[5m])) * 100) > 90
     6â†’        for: 5m
     7â†’        labels:
     8â†’          severity: warning
     9â†’        annotations:
    10â†’          summary: "{{ $labels.instance }} CPU > 90%"
    11â†’
    12â†’      - alert: HighMemory
    13â†’        expr: (1 - node_memory_MemAvailable_bytes/node_memory_MemTotal_bytes) * 100 > 85
    14â†’        for: 5m
    15â†’        labels:
    16â†’          severity: warning
    17â†’        annotations:
    18â†’          summary: "{{ $labels.instance }} RAM > 85%"
    19â†’
    20â†’      - alert: DiskAlmostFull
    21â†’        expr: 100 - (node_filesystem_avail_bytes{mountpoint="/"}/node_filesystem_size_bytes{mountpoint="/"} * 100) > 80
    22â†’        for: 10m
    23â†’        labels:
    24â†’          severity: critical
    25â†’        annotations:
    26â†’          summary: "{{ $labels.instance }} Disk > 80%"
    27â†’
    28â†’      - alert: ContainerDown
    29â†’        expr: absent(container_last_seen{name=~"adelie-.*"})
    30â†’        for: 1m
    31â†’        labels:
    32â†’          severity: critical
    33â†’        annotations:
    34â†’          summary: "Adelie ì»¨í…Œì´ë„ˆ ë‹¤ìš´ ê°ì§€"
    35â†’
    36â†’      - alert: ContainerRestart
    37â†’        expr: increase(container_restart_count{name=~"adelie-.*"}[5m]) > 0
    38â†’        for: 1m
    39â†’        labels:
    40â†’          severity: warning
    41â†’        annotations:
    42â†’          summary: "{{ $labels.name }} ì»¨í…Œì´ë„ˆ ì¬ì‹œì‘ ê°ì§€"
    43â†’

content.text:
Perfect! Now let me summarize all the findings. Here is the comprehensive report:

---

## **Adelie Investment - ëª¨ë‹ˆí„°ë§ ë° ëŒ€ì‹œë³´ë“œ ì¸í”„ë¼ êµ¬ì„± ì „ì²´ ì •ë³´**

### **1. `/home/hj/2026/project/adelie-investment/infra/monitoring/docker-compose.yml` - ì „ì²´ ë‚´ìš©**

```yaml
services:
  prometheus:
    image: prom/prometheus:latest
    container_name: adelie-prometheus
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "9090:9090"
    volumes:
      - ./prometheus.yml:/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
      - prometheus_data:/prometheus
    command:
      - --config.file=/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
      - --storage.tsdb.retention.time=30d
      - --web.enable-lifecycle

  grafana:
    image: grafana/grafana:latest
    container_name: adelie-grafana
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    environment:
      GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_USER: ${GRAFANA_ADMIN_USER:-admin}
      GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD: ${GRAFANA_ADMIN_PASSWORD:-changeme}
      GF_SERVER_ROOT_URL: https://monitoring.adelie-invest.com
      GF_AUTH_ANONYMOUS_ENABLED: "false"
    volumes:
      - grafana_data:/var/lib/grafana
      - ./grafana/provisioning:/etc/grafana/provisioning
    depends_on:
      - prometheus

  dashboard:
    build:
      context: ../docker-dashboard
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: adelie-dashboard
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8501:8501"
    volumes:
      - /home/ubuntu/.ssh/id_ed25519:/root/.ssh/id_ed25519:ro
      - /home/ubuntu/.ssh/known_hosts:/root/.ssh/known_hosts:ro
    environment:
      DB_HOST: ${DB_HOST:-postgres}
      DB_PORT: ${DB_PORT:-5432}
      DB_NAME: ${DB_NAME:-narrative_invest}
      DB_USER: ${DB_USER:-narative}
      DB_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-password}
      PROMETHEUS_URL: http://adelie-prometheus:9090
      GRAFANA_URL: https://monitoring.adelie-invest.com
    networks:
      - default
      - adelie-network
    depends_on:
      - prometheus

  cadvisor:
    image: gcr.io/cadvisor/cadvisor:latest
    container_name: adelie-cadvisor
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8080:8080"
    volumes:
      - /:/rootfs:ro
      - /var/run:/var/run:ro
      - /sys:/sys:ro
      - /var/lib/docker/:/var/lib/docker:ro
      - /dev/disk/:/dev/disk:ro
    privileged: true
    devices:
      - /dev/kmsg

networks:
  default: {}
  adelie-network:
    external: true
    name: adelie-network

volumes:
  prometheus_data:
  grafana_data:
```

---

### **2. `/home/hj/2026/project/adelie-investment/infra/docker-dashboard/.streamlit/config.toml` - ì „ì²´ ë‚´ìš©**

```yaml
scrape_configs:
```

### **5. Grafana ì•Œë¦¼ ê·œì¹™ (`rules.yml`)**

```yaml
groups:
  - name: infrastructure
    rules:
      - alert: HighCPU
        expr: 100 - (avg by(instance)(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle"}[5m])) * 100) > 90
        for: 5m
        labels:
          severity: warning
        annotations:
          summary: "{{ $labels.instance }} CPU > 90%"

      - alert: HighMemory
        expr: (1 - node_memory_MemAvailable_bytes/node_memory_MemTotal_bytes) * 100 > 85
        for: 5m
        labels:
          severity: warning
        annotations:
          summary: "{{ $labels.instance }} RAM > 85%"

      - alert: DiskAlmostFull
        expr: 100 - (node_filesystem_avail_bytes{mountpoint="/"}/node_filesystem_size_bytes{mountpoint="/"} * 100) > 80
        for: 10m
        labels:
          severity: critical
        annotations:
          summary: "{{ $labels.instance }} Disk > 80%"

      - alert: ContainerDown
        expr: absent(container_last_seen{name=~"adelie-.*"})
        for: 1m
        labels:
          severity: critical
        annotations:
          summary: "Adelie ì»¨í…Œì´ë„ˆ ë‹¤ìš´ ê°ì§€"

      - alert: ContainerRestart
        expr: increase(container_restart_count{name=~"adelie-.*"}[5m]) > 0
        for: 1m
        labels:
          severity: warning
        annotations:
          summary: "{{ $labels.name }} ì»¨í…Œì´ë„ˆ ì¬ì‹œì‘ ê°ì§€"
```

### **6. Grafana ì•Œë¦¼ ì •ì±… (`notification_policies.yml`)**

```yaml
apiVersion: 1
policies:
  - orgId: 1
    receiver: discord-webhook
    group_by:
      - alertname
    group_wait: 30s
    group_interval: 5m
    repeat_interval: 4h
    routes:
      - receiver: discord-webhook
        matchers:
          - severity=critical
        group_wait: 10s
        repeat_interval: 1h
      - receiver: default-email
        matchers:
          - severity=warning
        repeat_interval: 12h
```

```yaml
apiVersion: 1
```

## **Adelie Investment - ëª¨ë‹ˆí„°ë§ ë° ëŒ€ì‹œë³´ë“œ ì¸í”„ë¼ êµ¬ì„± ì „ì²´ ì •ë³´**

### **1. `/home/hj/2026/project/adelie-investment/infra/monitoring/docker-compose.yml` - ì „ì²´ ë‚´ìš©**

```yaml
services:
  prometheus:
    image: prom/prometheus:latest
    container_name: adelie-prometheus
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "9090:9090"
    volumes:
      - ./prometheus.yml:/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
      - prometheus_data:/prometheus
    command:
      - --config.file=/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
      - --storage.tsdb.retention.time=30d
      - --web.enable-lifecycle

  grafana:
    image: grafana/grafana:latest
    container_name: adelie-grafana
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    environment:
      GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_USER: ${GRAFANA_ADMIN_USER:-admin}
      GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD: ${GRAFANA_ADMIN_PASSWORD:-changeme}
      GF_SERVER_ROOT_URL: https://monitoring.adelie-invest.com
      GF_AUTH_ANONYMOUS_ENABLED: "false"
    volumes:
      - grafana_data:/var/lib/grafana
      - ./grafana/provisioning:/etc/grafana/provisioning
    depends_on:
      - prometheus

  dashboard:
    build:
      context: ../docker-dashboard
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: adelie-dashboard
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8501:8501"
    volumes:
      - /home/ubuntu/.ssh/id_ed25519:/root/.ssh/id_ed25519:ro
      - /home/ubuntu/.ssh/known_hosts:/root/.ssh/known_hosts:ro
    environment:
      DB_HOST: ${DB_HOST:-postgres}
      DB_PORT: ${DB_PORT:-5432}
      DB_NAME: ${DB_NAME:-narrative_invest}
      DB_USER: ${DB_USER:-narative}
      DB_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-password}
      PROMETHEUS_URL: http://adelie-prometheus:9090
      GRAFANA_URL: https://monitoring.adelie-invest.com
    networks:
      - default
      - adelie-network
    depends_on:
      - prometheus

  cadvisor:
    image: gcr.io/cadvisor/cadvisor:latest
    container_name: adelie-cadvisor
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8080:8080"
    volumes:
      - /:/rootfs:ro
      - /var/run:/var/run:ro
      - /sys:/sys:ro
      - /var/lib/docker/:/var/lib/docker:ro
      - /dev/disk/:/dev/disk:ro
    privileged: true
    devices:
      - /dev/kmsg

networks:
  default: {}
  adelie-network:
    external: true
    name: adelie-network

volumes:
  prometheus_data:
  grafana_data:
```

Excellent! Now I have critical information:

**Critical Finding**: The Cloudflare Tunnel config shows:
```yaml
- hostname: dashboard.adelie-invest.com
  service: http://10.10.10.10:8501
```

**This is pointing to `10.10.10.10:8501` (infra-server), NOT to deploy-test (10.10.10.20:8501)!**

But the deploy-test server has `adelie-dashboard` running on port 8501 (0.0.0.0:8501). And deploy-test's IP is 10.10.10.20.

**Committed** to develop branch, pushed to origin.

**Deploy to deploy-test**:

- Committed and applied to deploy-test

### Second Request

Plan written: rebuild with `--no-cache` as fix.

### Cloudflare Tunnel Discovery (Critical)

After exploring `infra/monitoring/` and checking Cloudflare Tunnel config on deploy-test:

```yaml
ingress:
```

**This is the real root cause**: `dashboard.adelie-invest.com` routes to infra-server (10.10.10.10:8501), NOT to deploy-test (10.10.10.20)'s `adelie-dashboard` container. All fixes applied to deploy-test's container are NOT visible to users accessing the URL.

Given that Cloudflare Tunnel â†’ infra-server (10.10.10.10:8501), the user is accessing the dashboard on INFRA-SERVER, not deploy-test. The infra-server dashboard might have different code. The ImportError on infra-server's dashboard would happen if:

- OR infra-server's dashboard image is stale

All our code fixes (feedback.py text() fix, network fixes) were applied to deploy-test's `infra/monitoring/docker-compose.yml` but NOT to infra-server's `infra/docker-compose.yml`.

The plan to fix Cloudflare Tunnel is the right path. Once we redirect to deploy-test (with proper nginx proxy), the ImportError on infra-server will stop being relevant.

But we still need to address why the ImportError occurs even on deploy-test. The manual test shows `inject_custom_css` is importable, but Streamlit's `exec(code, module.__dict__)` fails.

Wait - the ImportError is happening on infra-server (what users actually see via Cloudflare Tunnel). Once we fix Cloudflare Tunnel to point to deploy-test, users will see deploy-test's dashboard. On deploy-test, our diagnostics show the functions are importable. So the issue might resolve naturally once Cloudflare is fixed.

However, there's still the possibility of the exec() context issue. To be safe, the plan should also address potential `_stcore` and import issues.

The ImportError is happening because the page files in `/app/pages/` are trying to import `inject_custom_css` from `utils.ui_components`, but that function doesn't exist in the module even though the file itself is present. The real problem is that even though manual imports work fine on deploy-test, Streamlit's `exec()` function might be running the page files in a context where the Python path isn't properly set up, preventing the import from working even though the module exists in the container.

The most reliable solution is to explicitly manipulate `sys.path` directly in the page files themselvesâ€”this ensures the imports work regardless of how Streamlit executes them. Now I need to check the current plan and add this ImportError fix.

"""DB í…Œì´ë¸” ë¸Œë¼ìš°ì € + ë¹„ì¦ˆë‹ˆìŠ¤ ëŒ€ì‹œë³´ë“œ + íŒŒì´í”„ë¼ì¸ ìƒíƒœ"""

import streamlit as st

    inject_custom_css,

# plotly ì‚¬ìš© ê°€ëŠ¥ ì—¬ë¶€

    import plotly.express as px

except ImportError:
    HAS_PLOTLY = False

HOST = DEPLOY_SERVER["host"]

# CSS ì£¼ì…

    ["ğŸ“‹ í…Œì´ë¸” ë¸Œë¼ìš°ì €", "ğŸ”„ íŒŒì´í”„ë¼ì¸ ìƒíƒœ", "ğŸ“Š ë¹„ì¦ˆë‹ˆìŠ¤ ëŒ€ì‹œë³´ë“œ", "âš ï¸ ë°ì´í„° ê´€ë¦¬"]
)

    render_section_header("í…Œì´ë¸” ëª©ë¡", "ğŸ“‹")

    try:
        tables_df = get_tables()
    except Exception as e:
        st.error(f"DB ì—°ê²° ì‹¤íŒ¨: {e}")

But I'm realizing there might be a simpler pathâ€”what if I could reuse the existing frontend nginx container instead of spinning up a new one? That would better align with using the existing infrastructure rather than adding new components. port 80. It's on `adelie-network`. The dashboard container is ALSO on `adelie-network`. 

So we could:
1. Add `dashboard.adelie-invest.com` server block to the FRONTEND nginx config
2. This nginx would proxy to `dashboard:8501` and rewrite `_stcore` paths
3. Change Cloudflare `dashboard.adelie-invest.com` â†’ `localhost:80` (same as `demo.adelie-invest.com`)

This would truly "reuse existing infrastructure"! But it requires:

- Rebuilding the frontend Docker image
- Redeploying frontend

That might be more disruptive than adding a simple nginx container to monitoring.

Actually, I think I'm overthinking this. The user wants to maximize use of the existing server without disrupting the main deployment stack. Adding nginx to the monitoring compose file respects both constraintsâ€”it extends the monitoring infrastructure without touching the frontend or backend services. Let me go with that approach. Since our manual test on deploy-test worked fine and we recently rebuilt the image, redirecting Cloudflare to deploy-test should resolve the ImportError that's coming from infra-server's outdated image. The remaining fixes are straightforward: update the Cloudflare Tunnel configuration to point to deploy-test's Streamlit, add nginx to the monitoring compose for `_stcore` rewriting, fix the config.toml sidebar warning, and update the documentation. updated plan now.

1. **Cloudflare Tunnel fix with minimal impact**: The plan should explain why we're changing Cloudflare to point to deploy-test's monitoring stack (which already runs the dashboard), not to infra-server

4. **Documentation updates**: CLAUDE.md service URL table, infra-ops.md

Key points to address:


The root cause is infra-server's stale dashboard image lacking the `inject_custom_css` function, so I need to redirect the Cloudflare Tunnel from `http://10.10.10.10:8501` to `http://localhost:8501` by adding nginx to the monitoring compose on deploy-test. The monitoring.adelie-invest.com subdomain is already correctly configured pointing to Grafana, so that needs no changes. I'll update the CLAUDE.md service table to reflect that the dashboard now runs on deploy-test:8501.

Now I'm thinking through why the nginx-in-monitoring approach is the minimal way to reuse existing infrastructureâ€”the monitoring compose already runs on deploy-test with prometheus, grafana, and the dashboard, so adding a lightweight nginx service requires no new Dockerfile, just the alpine image. Modifying the frontend nginx instead would mean rebuilding the entire frontend image, which is far more disruptive.

I'm restructuring the plan file to include a dedicated Problems section that covers all four issues with their root causes, then for each fix I'll explain why it's the minimal-impact approach.

content.content:
services:
  prometheus:
    image: prom/prometheus:latest
    container_name: adelie-prometheus
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "9090:9090"
    volumes:
      - ./prometheus.yml:/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
      - prometheus_data:/prometheus
    command:
      - --config.file=/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
      - --storage.tsdb.retention.time=30d
      - --web.enable-lifecycle

  grafana:
    image: grafana/grafana:latest
    container_name: adelie-grafana
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    environment:
      GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_USER: ${GRAFANA_ADMIN_USER:-admin}
      GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD: ${GRAFANA_ADMIN_PASSWORD:-changeme}
      GF_SERVER_ROOT_URL: https://monitoring.adelie-invest.com
      GF_AUTH_ANONYMOUS_ENABLED: "false"
    volumes:
      - grafana_data:/var/lib/grafana
      - ./grafana/provisioning:/etc/grafana/provisioning
    depends_on:
      - prometheus

  # nginx: dashboard ì•ë‹¨ í”„ë¡ì‹œ (Streamlit _stcore ê²½ë¡œ ì¬ì‘ì„± + í¬íŠ¸ 8501 ë…¸ì¶œ)
  nginx:
    image: nginx:alpine
    container_name: adelie-dashboard-nginx
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8501:80"          # ì™¸ë¶€ 8501 â†’ nginx 80 â†’ dashboard:8501
    volumes:
      - ./nginx-dashboard.conf:/etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf:ro
    depends_on:
      - dashboard
    networks:
      - default

  dashboard:
    build:
      context: ../docker-dashboard
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: adelie-dashboard
    restart: unless-stopped
    expose:
      - "8501"             # ë‚´ë¶€ ë„¤íŠ¸ì›Œí¬ë§Œ ì ‘ê·¼ (nginxê°€ í”„ë¡ì‹œ)
    volumes:
      - /home/ubuntu/.ssh/id_ed25519:/root/.ssh/id_ed25519:ro
      - /home/ubuntu/.ssh/known_hosts:/root/.ssh/known_hosts:ro
    environment:
      DB_HOST: ${DB_HOST:-postgres}
      DB_PORT: ${DB_PORT:-5432}
      DB_NAME: ${DB_NAME:-narrative_invest}
      DB_USER: ${DB_USER:-narative}
      DB_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-password}
      PROMETHEUS_URL: http://adelie-prometheus:9090
      GRAFANA_URL: https://monitoring.adelie-invest.com
    networks:
      - default
      - adelie-network
    depends_on:
      - prometheus

  cadvisor:
    image: gcr.io/cadvisor/cadvisor:latest
    container_name: adelie-cadvisor
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8080:8080"
    volumes:
      - /:/rootfs:ro
      - /var/run:/var/run:ro

toolUseResult.stdout:
services:
  prometheus:
    image: prom/prometheus:latest
    container_name: adelie-prometheus
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "9090:9090"
    volumes:
      - ./prometheus.yml:/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
      - prometheus_data:/prometheus
    command:
      - --config.file=/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
      - --storage.tsdb.retention.time=30d
      - --web.enable-lifecycle

  grafana:
    image: grafana/grafana:latest
    container_name: adelie-grafana
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    environment:
      GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_USER: ${GRAFANA_ADMIN_USER:-admin}
      GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD: ${GRAFANA_ADMIN_PASSWORD:-changeme}
      GF_SERVER_ROOT_URL: https://monitoring.adelie-invest.com
      GF_AUTH_ANONYMOUS_ENABLED: "false"
    volumes:
      - grafana_data:/var/lib/grafana
      - ./grafana/provisioning:/etc/grafana/provisioning
    depends_on:
      - prometheus

  # nginx: dashboard ì•ë‹¨ í”„ë¡ì‹œ (Streamlit _stcore ê²½ë¡œ ì¬ì‘ì„± + í¬íŠ¸ 8501 ë…¸ì¶œ)
  nginx:
    image: nginx:alpine
    container_name: adelie-dashboard-nginx
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8501:80"          # ì™¸ë¶€ 8501 â†’ nginx 80 â†’ dashboard:8501
    volumes:
      - ./nginx-dashboard.conf:/etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf:ro
    depends_on:
      - dashboard
    networks:
      - default

  dashboard:
    build:
      context: ../docker-dashboard
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: adelie-dashboard
    restart: unless-stopped
    expose:
      - "8501"             # ë‚´ë¶€ ë„¤íŠ¸ì›Œí¬ë§Œ ì ‘ê·¼ (nginxê°€ í”„ë¡ì‹œ)
    volumes:
      - /home/ubuntu/.ssh/id_ed25519:/root/.ssh/id_ed25519:ro
      - /home/ubuntu/.ssh/known_hosts:/root/.ssh/known_hosts:ro
    environment:
      DB_HOST: ${DB_HOST:-postgres}
      DB_PORT: ${DB_PORT:-5432}
      DB_NAME: ${DB_NAME:-narrative_invest}
      DB_USER: ${DB_USER:-narative}
      DB_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-password}
      PROMETHEUS_URL: http://adelie-prometheus:9090
      GRAFANA_URL: https://monitoring.adelie-invest.com
    networks:
      - default
      - adelie-network
    depends_on:
      - prometheus

  cadvisor:
    image: gcr.io/cadvisor/cadvisor:latest
    container_name: adelie-cadvisor
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8080:8080"
    volumes:
      - /:/rootfs:ro
      - /var/run:/var/run:ro

content.thinking:
Now I'm getting a clearer picture:

1. **deploy-test is on `prod` branch** - NOT develop!
   - HEAD: `987dc45` (apply commits made in previous sessions)
   - It has PR #18 as ancestor but NOT PR #22-#28 (those are on a different branch)

Wait, but the `git log --oneline HEAD...origin/develop --left-right` showed deploy-test is AHEAD of origin/develop by 14 commits. Let me reconsider...

Actually, looking again:
- The `>` symbol means commits in `origin/develop` but NOT in `HEAD` (deploy-test)


- So those 14 commits (PR #22-28) are in `origin/develop` but NOT in deploy-test's `prod` branch, meaning deploy-test is actually BEHIND
- But deploy-test also has 2 local commits that were made directly on the server and never pushed to origin: the dashboard monitoring and DB network fixes
- So I need to map out all the branches across both origin and deploy-test, then figure out how to get the latest changes from origin/develop synced to the deployment server while preserving those local fixes

.

input.command: git fetch origin 2>/dev/null && echo "=== All remote branches ===" && git branch -r --sort=-committerdate | head -30 && echo "=== Local vs Remote branches ===" && git branch -vv && echo "=== origin/main vs origin/develop vs origin/prod ===" && git log --oneline origin/main -5 && echo "---prod---" && git log --oneline origin/prod -5 2>/dev/null || echo "no origin/prod"

input.command: echo "=== Commits in origin/develop NOT in origin/main ===" && git log --oneline origin/main..origin/develop | head -20 && echo "=== Commits in origin/develop NOT in prod ===" && git log --oneline origin/prod..origin/develop 2>/dev/null | head -20 || echo "no origin/prod"

@echo ""

# --- Docker Hub Push ---
push:
	@echo "Docker Hub($(REGISTRY)) push..."
	docker push $(REGISTRY)/adelie-frontend:$(TAG)
	docker push $(REGISTRY)/adelie-backend-api:$(TAG)
	docker push $(REGISTRY)/adelie-ai-pipeline:$(TAG)

push-local:
	@for svc in frontend backend-api ai-pipeline; do \

	ssh deploy-test 'cd ~/adelie-investment && git pull origin develop && \

Now I have the complete picture. Let me write the comprehensive plan.

I'm realizing there's a potential issue with the deploy-test targetâ€”it runs `git pull origin develop` on a machine that's currently on the `prod` branch, which could cause a merge conflict or unexpected behavior. Let me trace through what actually happens: `git pull origin develop` should fetch and merge origin/develop into whatever the current branch is, so if deploy-test is on `prod`, it would try to merge develop into prod, which isn't what we want.

The cleaner approach would be to either keep deploy-test on the develop branch and just pull updates, or if we're using prod as the deployment branch, we should explicitly reset to origin/prod instead of pulling from develop. runs `git pull origin develop` - this would indeed merge origin/develop into whatever branch deploy-test is on. Since deploy-test is on `prod` branch, this would merge develop into prod locally on deploy-test. Then it pulls Docker images and restarts.

This is messy. I think the right approach is:
Option A: Switch deploy-test to develop branch (deploy directly from develop)
Option B: Merge develop â†’ prod â†’ push origin/prod â†’ deploy-test pulls origin/prod

The lxd/Makefile `sync-dev-branches` merges develop â†’ dev/* and pushes. There's no explicit develop â†’ prod merge step.

I think the workflow is meant to be:
1. deploy-test runs on `develop` directly (since lxd/Makefile just does `git pull origin develop`)
2. The `prod` branch is for production (actual production server, if they had one)

But currently deploy-test is on `prod` branch. This might be an error, or it might be intentional (they deployed a prod release).

Let me just include the plan: switch deploy-test to develop, git pull, then run the deploy commands.

Actually, I need to check: the `docker-compose.prod.yml` pulls `dorae222/adelie-*:latest` images. The images are built from the local code (make build). So the deploy process is:
1. Build images from local code
2. Push to Docker Hub

The git pull on deploy-test is just for config files (nginx, docker-compose.prod.yml, etc.), NOT for the Docker image content. So the real process should be: commit local changes to develop, build and push the Docker images, then deploy-test pulls those images along with any config updates.

For the git state on deploy-test, I need to handle the staged files and diverged branch separately. However, these files are already in origin/develop from earlier commits, so switching deploy-test to develop and pulling will sync everything properly.

Then I'll push those changes to origin/develop, build the Docker images with all the PR changes plus the new frontend commits, push the images to Docker Hub, and finally deploy to deploy-test by switching to develop, pulling the latest changes, and running the docker compose commands to pull and start the containers.

After that, I need to run the database migrations with alembic, restart the monitoring stack to ensure nginx and the dashboard are up to date, sync the dev branches by merging develop into each one, sync the LXD containers so they pull their respective branches, and optionally push to the local registry if needed.

Excellent! Now I can see exactly what changed in the past 2 days. The key findings:

**Yesterday and today's changes by service:**

**Frontend (ë¹Œë“œ í•„ìš”):**
- Many frontend files changed: Home.jsx, Education.jsx, TutorModal.jsx, MessageBubble.jsx, SessionSidebar.jsx, ActivityArchive.jsx, etc.
- Also: ChatFAB.jsx (locally modified), TutorChat.jsx (locally modified)
- â†’ `make build-frontend` definitely needed

**Backend API (ë¹Œë“œ í•„ìš”):**
- Many FastAPI changes: tutor.py, tutor_sessions.py, portfolio.py, quiz_reward.py, feedback.py, keywords.py, guardrail.py, tutor_engine.py, etc.


- â†’ `make build-api` definitely needed

**AI Pipeline (ë¹Œë“œ í•„ìš”!):**
- Massive datapipeline changes across graph.py, run.py, multi_provider_client.py, llm_utils.py, llm_observability.py, llm_response_cache.py, all prompt templates, curation.py, chart_agent.py, interface3.py, and more
- â†’ `make build-pipeline` also needed

All three services have substantial changes requiring rebuilds.

Looking at the Makefile, I see there are three images: frontend, backend-api, and ai-pipeline. The chatbot code lives in the backend-api image since it's imported by tutor_engine.py rather than being a separate service, so the rebuild plan covers all three.

content.thinking:
Now I have very precise timing information. Let me analyze:

**Docker images built on Feb 19 at 09:25:49 UTC** (frontend) and **09:26:07 UTC** (backend-api).

**Commits AFTER the Feb 19 09:25 build:**

Looking at the timestamps, commits after Feb 19 09:26 UTC are:
- `784dfebe` 2026-02-19 21:09:03 +0900 (= 2026-02-19 12:09:03 UTC) - docs: dashboard URL
- `c5f9c766` 2026-02-19 21:08:54 +0900 (= 2026-02-19 12:08:54 UTC) - fix(infra): nginx


- `7a2dd4a7` 2026-02-19 19:51:46 +0900 (= 2026-02-19 10:51:46 UTC) - fix(dashboard): adelie-network
- `4fb959c8` 2026-02-19 19:50:05 +0900 (= 2026-02-19 10:50:05 UTC) - fix(dashboard): SQLAlchemy
- `38464991` 2026-02-19 10:15:55 UTC - feat: stabilize keyword card icon mapping

So there are several commits between the build time and the later ones, with the earliest being the keyword card icon mapping feature. I'm checking the UTC timestamps more carefully now. The commits with `+0000` timezone are already in UTC, so `7b43b7c` at 16:04 and `38464991` at 10:15 both came after the 09:25 UTC build time. The one with `+0900` offset needs conversionâ€”subtracting 9 hours from 18:09 gives 09:09 UTC, which was just before the build cutoff. So the images captured `4ed3e5f8` but not the later commits. Looking at the remaining commits from February 20th, there are several more changes that came after the current imagesâ€”frontend work on the education calendar and chatbot features like guardrails and daily briefing fixes, culminating with PR #23 merged around 6:23 UTC. Looking at the additional commits from Feb 20, there are four more feature and merge commits that also aren't included in the current Docker imagesâ€”the tutor UX improvements, guardrail updates, and their corresponding merges. Combined with the infrastructure commits from Feb 19, this means the images are missing an entire day's worth of changes.

The missing frontend changes span activity calendar redesign, calendar navigation, reward flow, keyword icon mapping, and several component updates across TutorModal, SessionSidebar, and authentication logic. On the backend, the tutor.py and tutor_sessions.py files have significant updates that also need to be rebuilt into the images.

For the AI pipeline, the Feb 13 image predates even the KST date handling unification from Feb 19, so there's a substantial gap including all the datapipeline observability, caching, and graph execution changes from the past couple days. I'm trying to figure out the best approach for getting everything synced up.

Looking at the prod branch history, the latest commit there is the dashboard UI white mode update, which was before PR #19 merged on Feb 20. So the Feb 19 09:25 UTC build would have included PR #18 but not the subsequent changes. I need to trace back when that specific dashboard commit was made to understand the exact state of the prod branch at build time. So the images built on Feb 19 at 09:25 are missing all the significant changes from Feb 20 â€” the chatbot improvements, tutor sessions, and several PRs that came after. I need to make sure those updates are included in the new build.

The plan looks quite good now. Let me check the remaining items:

1. The plan correctly identifies Step 1 as complete âœ“

Now I'm reviewing the actual status across all components: Step 1 is done with a clean commit, the database migration is already at head, and monitoring is running fine with both dashboards up for 29 hours. But the Docker images are stale from mid-February, deploy-test is still pointing to prod instead of the right branch, and the dev branches plus LXD servers haven't been synced yet.

The plan file looks accurate, but I'm cross-checking the dev branch details against what I'm seeing locallyâ€”the frontend and chatbot branches are each just one commit behind develop, while the pipeline, backend, and infra branches are significantly further behind with multiple commits to catch up on. The sync-dev-branches target iterates through each dev branch, checks it out locally, merges develop into it, and pushes the result back to origin. Since the local branches are at 1382b32 and develop is at 091a1bb, the merge will create a new commit on top of the local state.

However, the origin branches are actually ahead of the local copiesâ€”origin/dev/frontend is at 200bd1e and origin/dev/chatbot is at 218a7e2, both newer than the local 1382b32. This means when we push after merging, we're trying to push an older local state merged with develop back to origin, which would be a non-fast-forward push that could overwrite and lose the newer commits already on origin. I see the real issue nowâ€”the local dev/* branches are out of sync with their remote counterparts, so a straightforward merge and push would fail. The Makefile would need to reset to the origin state first before merging, but since modifying existing code is outside scope, I should just note this limitation in the plan. Running a script to reset local branches to origin first, then executing sync-dev-branches, would be the safest approach to avoid the non-fast-forward errors.

- Cloudflare Tunnel on deploy-test points `dashboard.adelie-invest.com` â†’ `http://10.10.10.10:8501` (infra-server!) instead of deploy-test
- infra-server has stale dashboard image without `inject_custom_css`
- Fix: Change Cloudflare to `localhost:8501` + add nginx for `_stcore` path rewriting
